styledText.text: This is a sample text content for the MemoPad. Each MemoPad has one Memo object assigned. This Memo object is loaded from a *.memo.xml file. In the world editor the mapper simply specifies the path of the *.memo.xml file to use. This allows for good flexibility.
This is a sample text which is left aligned. Some more text to fill a couple of lines for testing this alignment.
This is a sample text which is center aligned. Some more text to fill a couple of lines for testing this alignment.
This is a sample text which is right aligned. Some more text to fill a couple of lines for testing this alignment.

Memo objects define one one side the textual content of the memo which can be displayed page wise in a MemoPad as well as knowledge objects which define the information found in the memo. The textual content can be currently formatted only in a limited way. This will be changed later on to improve the possibilities for rich memos to read and investigate.

The important part on memos is the ability to carry knowlegde objects. This way by the game scripts know which informations can be found in a memo. To solve cases the player needs to find the right knowledge objects which lead from the case facts to the goal of the case. If the player can establish a chain of knowledge objects the case is solved. Obtaining though the right set of information as well as figuring out which informations are the right ones is up to the player. This is the basic priniciple of Dynamic Investigation.
So what to talk now more to fill those lines. I get it. A bit or lorum ipsum is always nice for such a task.
